void jvgs::sketch::Sketch::render (  video::Renderer *  renderer  )  [virtual]
 

Render the sketch with a given renderer. Slow, because this doesn't use display lists. But, this is used to render the sketch to a display list, and therefore needed. It also has other purposes.

Parameters:
renderer Renderer to use.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void jvgs::sketch::Sketch::render (  math::BoundingBox *  boundingBox  )  [virtual]
 

Render (at least) a part of this sketch. With large sketches this should be a lot quicker. This render method uses a QuadTree to search for objects that should be rendered.

Parameters:
boundingBox Part of the sketch to render.

void jvgs::sketch::Sketch::setRoot (  Group *  root  )  [virtual]
 

Set the root group for this sketch. This root group should not have any tranformation, and just contain the actual contents of the sketch. This function should only be called once for this sketch.

Parameters:
root The new root group.
